search_strategy: Keywords extracted from analysis.json crash signature and root cause analysis. Searched llvm/circt repository using gh CLI with various related terms.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for StringType from moore to llvm dialect
results.crash_analysis: Discusses StringType handling in MooreToCore conversion. Related to our issue where string-typed module outputs are not properly converted, leaving port type empty.
results.notes: High relevance - addresses StringType support gap that directly relates to our crash where string output port is unconvertible

results.title: [ImportVerilog] Cannot compile forward decleared string type
results.crash_analysis: Reports failure to legalize moore.variable operation with string type. Error message indicates moore.ref<string> cannot be converted. Core issue: lack of string-type conversion in MooreToCore.
results.notes: High relevance - identical root cause: MooreToCore lacks string type conversion, leading to unconvertible types

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash when getting values to observe
results.crash_analysis: MooreToCore crash with dyn_cast assertion in getValuesToObserve function. Different specific operation but same crash pattern (dyn_cast assertion in MooreToCore context).
results.notes: Related pattern: dyn_cast assertion in MooreToCore, but different context (values to observe vs port info)

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash with sqrt/floor
results.crash_analysis: MooreToCore dyn_cast assertion during type conversion (real type). Pattern match: dyn_cast on non-existent value in MooreToCore conversion pipeline.
results.notes: Similar crash mechanism: dyn_cast assertion in MooreToCore during type conversion, suggests broader type handling issue

results.title: [Moore] Input triggers assertion in canonicalizer infra
results.crash_analysis: Moore dialect assertion in canonicalizer, different failure point than our sanitizeInOut assertion.
results.notes: Lower relevance - different crash mechanism (canonicalizer vs port handling)

top_match.title: [MooreToCore] Support for StringType from moore to llvm dialect
top_match.reason: Directly addresses StringType support in MooreToCore, which is the root cause of our crash: string output port type cannot be converted, leaving it empty/invalid, causing dyn_cast assertion in sanitizeInOut

secondary_match.title: [ImportVerilog] Cannot compile forward decleared string type
secondary_match.reason: Nearly identical root cause: MooreToCore conversion fails for string types, but manifests at moore.variable legalization rather than port sanitization

recommendation_rationale: Our crash is a specific manifestation of broader string type handling gaps in MooreToCore. Issues 8332 and 8283 track the core problem: MooreToCore lacks StringType support. Our crash is the consequence when a module port is declared as string type - it fails to convert, leaving the port type invalid, which sanitizeInOut then tries to dyn_cast to InOutType, triggering the assertion. This should be reported as a duplicate or related issue to 8332 (higher priority) or 8283.
action_items: Cross-reference with issue #8332 as the most relevant existing issue
Consider reporting as duplicate of #8332 with additional focus on module port-level impact
Alternatively, close as duplicate if developers indicate ongoing work in #8332
